ygData.subject: Re: Hi there :)
ygData.msgSnippet: I heartedly agree with you concerning knowing the game. Many of my friends who started out about the same time as me have gone way up in level (high 30 s and
ygData.messageBody:
I heartedly agree with you concerning knowing the
game. Many of my friends who started out about the same
time as me have gone way up in level (high 30's and
40's) while I just hit 27. They may be real good at
grouping and killing and getting tons of money and
experience, they know very little about the quests, npcs and
lay of the land. I , on the other hand, have found
many quests they did not know about (faydark ringmail
for instance) and can navigate through many of the
zones almost blindfolded. <br> I had to laugh when one
of them (name removed to protect her 35th cleric's
pride) did not know how to get to Kaladim from the druid
ring and then needed to be shown where the bank was.
<br> As for wisdom, don't let it worry you. Your game
play can always be adapted to match your mana pool. As
for myself, I am a halfling druid who started with
115 wisdom. Now, after many purchases, exchanges and
quests I have a wisdom of 168. If you want an extra
wisdom point, just go buy some paladin pickles from
Boomba the Big in Freeport. It's amazing what some
people will trade for stat enhancing food and even
alcohol. ;)<br> As for me, fish scales are always needed.
I am bravely exploring all the underwater regions
of Norrath.<br><br>Timmye Cousteau<br>The Wolf of
Karana<br>27th Aquanaut
